marketNews.title: Foreign Inflow, Big Banks Lead Rebound IHSG
marketNews.content:
The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) rose 0.5% to 7,109.20 on Friday, 31 January 2025, led by gains in BBCA (+3.3%) and BBRI (+2.4%) as foreign inflows entered the market. Net foreign inflow recorded at 297 billion rupiah for the day. Year-to-date, the index still shows a net foreign outflow of 3.7 trillion rupiah. Today's foreign inflow consisted of 268 billion rupiah in the regular market and 29 billion rupiah in the cash and negotiation market. The largest net foreign inflow in the regular market was contributed by BBRI (271 billion rupiah), BBCA (162 billion rupiah) and BBNI (44 billion rupiah). Bank Mandiri (BMRI) was the only big bank that recorded a net foreign outflow of 112 billion rupiah. 
Key Takeaway: We assess today's foreign inflow into big banks as an indication that the Indonesian market is becoming more attractive to foreign investors as US Treasury yields decline. If there is no escalation in US trade-policy tariffs that could affect US inflation and interest-rate outlook, we see further upside potential for big-bank stocks given their attractive valuations. The 1-year forward price-to-book ratios for big banks on Friday, 31 January were: BBRI 1.89× (approximately one standard deviation below the 10-year historical average); BMRI 1.79× (about 0.5 standard deviation above the 10-year average); BBNI 1.02× (about 0.5 standard deviation below the 10-year average); BBCA 3.99× (about 0.5 standard deviation above the 10-year average).

marketNews.title: Hanwha Plans to Acquire 40% of NOBU
marketNews.content:
Hanwha Life Insurance Co. Ltd. announced a plan to acquire approximately 3 billion rupiah worth (40%) of shares of Bank Nationalnobu (NOBU). The shares will be purchased from PT Putera Mulia Indonesia, PT Prima Cakrawala Sentosa, and Multipolar (MLPL). 
Alam Sutera Realty (ASRI) targets marketing sales of 3.5 trillion rupiah in 2025, compared with a 2024 target of 2.8 trillion rupiah and an actual 2024 realization of 3.16 trillion rupiah. ASRI expects 85% of the 2025 marketing sales to come from the residential segment and the remainder from the commercial segment. The company said it will focus on releasing clusters in Sutera Rasuna, Suvarna Sutera, and Sutera Nexen in the coming years. 
Indosat (ISAT) and the Wadhwani Foundation signed a memorandum of understanding worth 3.5 trillion rupiah to provide artificial-intelligence training for 1 million digital talents and 100,000 Indonesian entrepreneurs. The partnership will run for three years. 
Sarana Menara Nusantara (TOWR), through its subsidiary PT Iforte Energi Nusantara, signed a green-loan and/or revolving credit facility agreement with a total committed amount of 150 billion rupiah from Bank SMBC Indonesia (BTPN). The facilities will mature three months after the last drawdown date of each facility. 
VKTR's Director of Mobility Technology, Achmad Amri Aswono Putro, purchased 12.5 million VKTR shares at an average price of 100 rupiah per share on 23 January 2025, amounting to approximately 1.25 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Achmad Amri Aswono Putro's ownership in VKTR increased from zero to 0.07%. 
Ashmore Asset Management Indonesia (AMOR) plans to distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of 14 rupiah per share. The cum-date is on the regular and negotiation markets on 7 February 2025, with payment on 24 February 2025. Based on AMOR's closing price of 680 rupiah per share on Friday, 31 January, the implied dividend yield is 2.1%. This is the second interim dividend for fiscal year 2024, following an interim dividend of 27.5 rupiah per share announced in October 2024. 
Hexindo Adiperkasa (HEXA) reported a net profit of 10.1 million US dollars (+90.5% quarter-on-quarter, –21.8% year-on-year) for 3Q24 ending 31 December 2024. This result brought HEXA's 9-month net profit to 21.1 million US dollars (-51.8% year-on-year). The quarterly profit increase was mainly driven by a 2% quarter-on-quarter revenue increase and an operating margin rise to 9.8% (vs. 9.2% in 2Q24). The profit was also supported by other income that grew 62% quarter-on-quarter, including a warranty claim income of 1.1 million US dollars.

marketNews.title: Investment Ministry Reports 4Q24 Investment Realization
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Investment and De-industrialization reported that investment realization in Indonesia in 4Q24 reached 452.8 trillion rupiah (+4.9% quarter-on-quarter, +23.8% year-on-year), with 54.3% of it coming from foreign direct investment. This result brings total investment realization in Indonesia for 2024 to 1,714.2 trillion rupiah (+20.8% year-on-year), exceeding the government target of 1,650 trillion rupiah (103.9% of target). Labor absorption reached approximately 2.5 million people. Foreign investment contributed 52.5% of total investment realization in 2024. Geographically, regions outside Java contributed 52.2% of total investment realization in 2024.

marketNews.title: Government Bans Sale of 3 kg LPG through Retailers
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that the government has prohibited the sale of 3-kilogram liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) through retailers starting 1 February 2025. Energy and Mineral Resources Minister Yuliot Tanjung said that retailers wishing to continue selling subsidised LPG must be registered as an official Pertamina base or sub-distributor. The policy aims to ensure that subsidised LPG distribution reaches the intended beneficiaries. A shorter distribution chain is also expected to keep the price of 3-kg LPG aligned with government-set levels.

marketNews.title: US President Trump Warns BRICS on Dollar Replacement
marketNews.content: US President Donald Trump, on Thursday 30 January, warned BRICS member countries not to replace the US dollar as a reserve currency, stating that doing so could trigger a 100% import tariff. Indonesia has been a permanent BRICS member since early 2025.

marketNews.title: US President Trump Announces New Tariffs
marketNews.content: US President Donald Trump said on Thursday 30 January that he will implement a 25% import tariff on Canada and Mexico starting 1 February 2025, together with a 10% tariff on China. Trump noted that it has not yet been decided whether the tariffs will also cover oil commodities. He emphasized that the tariffs are intended to address large numbers of undocumented migrants and narcotics crossing the US border, as well as the US trade deficit with neighboring countries.

marketNews.title: Gold Spot Price Reaches All-Time High
marketNews.content: The spot price of gold rose 1.4% to $2,796 per troy ounce on Thursday 30 January, marking an all-time high. The price increase was driven by safe-haven demand amid geopolitical uncertainty and concerns over global economic growth due to the US tariff threats announced by President Donald Trump.

marketNews.title: US Economy Growth Q4 2024
marketNews.content: The United States recorded an economic growth of 2.3% year-on-year in 4Q24 (versus 3.1% in 3Q24), based on preliminary estimates. The figure fell short of the consensus expectation of 2.6% year-on-year. US growth in 4Q24 was supported by consumer spending, the largest contributor to the US economy, which grew 4.2% year-on-year, reaching its highest level since the end of 4Q21. Over the full year 2024, the US economy grew 2.8% year-on-year (versus 2.9% in 2023).

marketNews.title: LQ45 and IDX30 Rebalancing Effective 3 Feb
marketNews.content: The LQ45 and IDX30 indices officially performed a rebalancing at market close on Friday 31 January, effective from 3 February to 30 April 2025. The rebalancing had been announced earlier on Wednesday 22 January. Details are as follows: LQ45 – additions: CTRA, JPFA, MAPA; deletions: BUKA, INTP, MTEL. IDX30 – additions: EXCL, ISAT; deletions: ACES, PGEO.

tickerNews.content: Hanwha Life Insurance Co. Ltd. announced a plan to acquire approximately 3 billion rupiah worth (40%) of shares of Bank Nationalnobu (NOBU). The shares will be purchased from PT Putera Mulia Indonesia, PT Prima Cakrawala Sentosa, and Multipolar (MLPL).

The facilities will mature three months after the last drawdown date of each facility.

tickerNews.title: Ashmore Asset Management Indonesia Announces 2024 Interim Dividend
tickerNews.content: Ashmore Asset Management Indonesia (AMOR) plans to distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of 14 rupiah per share. The cum-date is on the regular and negotiation markets on 7 February 2025, with payment on 24 February 2025. Based on AMOR's closing price of 680 rupiah per share on Friday, 31 January, the implied dividend yield is 2.1%. This is the second interim dividend for fiscal year 2024, following an interim dividend of 27.5 rupiah per share announced in October 2024.

tickerNews.title: Hexindo Reports Q3 2024 Net Profit of $10.1 Million
tickerNews.content: Hexindo Adiperkasa (HEXA) reported a net profit of 10.1 million US dollars (+90.5% quarter-on-quarter, –21.8% year-on-year) for 3Q24 ending 31 December 2024. This result brought HEXA's 9-month net profit to 21.1 million US dollars (-51.8% year-on-year). The quarterly profit increase was mainly driven by a 2% quarter-on-quarter revenue increase and an operating margin rise to 9.8% (vs. 9.2% in 2Q24). The profit was also supported by other income that grew 62% quarter-on-quarter, including a warranty claim income of 1.1 million US dollars.
